meanings.definition: Set apart or separated from others.
meanings.sent1: The playground had a segregated area for younger kids.
meanings.sent2: The segregated section of the library was dedicated to science books.
meanings.sent3: The segregated seating at the movie theater made it easy for friends to find each other.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like segregated compartments, each neatly organized.
meanings.sent5: The segregated lanes on the road helped maintain order and safety.

meanings.definition: Divided or separated based on race, religion, or other factors.
meanings.sent1: The segregated schools in the past had different entrances for students of different races.
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood was segregated, with certain streets predominantly inhabited by specific ethnic groups.
meanings.sent3: The segregated ice cream flavors made it hard for him to choose just one.
meanings.sent4: The segregated teams in the competition represented different regions of the country.
meanings.sent5: The segregated communities had their own unique traditions and customs.
